{{Infobox person | name = Mariana Klaveno | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birthname = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | yearsactive = 2004âpresent | occupation = Actress | spouse = | awards = }}'''Mariana Klaveno''' is an American actress best known for her role as [[Characters_of_The_Southern_Vampires_Mysteries#Lorena_Ball_.28Krasiki.29|Lorena Ball (Krasiki)]] in HBO's ''[[True Blood]]''. She became a credited regular in season 2 and 3, playing the part of the "maker" of the main character [[Bill Compton (The Southern Vampire Mysteries)|Bill Compton]]. She also starred in the feature film ''[[While the Children Sleep]]'' (released as ''The Sitter'' on DVD) in the role of Abby Read.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.seattlepi.com/shockroom/2008/08/15/the-sitter-a-k-a-while-the-children-sleep-2007/ |title=The Sitter, a.k.a. While the Children Sleep (2007) |first=S. P. |last=Miskowski |date=August 15, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/moviewatch.aspx?id=while_the_children_sleep |title=WHILE THE CHILDREN SLEEP (LIFETIME) |publisher=thefutoncritic.com |accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref> She's guest starred in TV show episodes of ''[[Standoff (TV series)|Standoff]]'', ''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]'', the fifth episode of the sixth season of [[Dexter_(TV_series)|Dexter]], acting as "Professor Porter", and others.
== Early life == Klaveno grew up with three siblings on a family owned and operated farm in [[Endicott, Washington]]. She graduated from the [[University of Washington]] in [[Seattle]] with a B.A. in Theater, studying there with [[Jon Jory]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hbo.com/true-blood#/true-blood/cast-and-crew/lorena/bio/mariana-klaveno.html |title=HBO: True Blood: Mariana Klaveno: Bio |publisher=[[hbo.com]] |accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref>
== True Blood == Klaveno first appeared in the fifth episode of season one as the vampire Lorena, who turned Bill Compton into a vampire. Her character became a regular with starring credits in the second half of season two.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117996189?refCatId=28 |title=Mariana Klaveno |first=Byron |last=Perry |date=November 19, 2008 |publisher=[[variety.com]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogs.pioneerlocal.com/entertainment/2009/07/true_blood_review_meet_your_ma.html |title='True Blood' review: Meet your maker in 'Never Let Me Go' |first=Jennifer |last=Thomas |date=July 20, 2009 |publisher=pioneerlocal.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trueblood-news.com/interview-with-mariana-klaveno-i-have-a-feeling-that-lorena-is-pissed-off |title=Interview with Mariana Klaveno: âI have a feeling that Lorena is pissed off!â |date=November 6, 2009 |publisher=trueblood-news.com}}</ref>
She was nominated with the starring cast for the "Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series" at the [[16th Screen Actors Guild Awards]] in January 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sagawards.org/awards/nominees-and-recipients/16th-annual-screen-actors-guild-awards |title=The 16th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards |publisher=[[Screen Actors Guild Award|sagawards.org]] |accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref>
She and her costar [[Stephen Moyer]] were awarded the "Holy Shit Scene of the Year" award at the Spike [[2010 Scream Awards]] for their scene in season three where Bill turns Lorena's head around 180 degrees while having sex.<ref>[http://www.spike.com/event/scream2010/page/vote/category/39538/holy-sht-scene-of spike 2010 holy shit scene award]</ref>
